Every woman <35 not ready to be a parent yet should have feasible options for freezing eggs that donâ€™t involve $15k+ debt
Beyond that, and some standard loan products, there are no great options for women 20-35 to freeze their eggs resulting in less women also donating eggs for parents who are in need of donor eggs.  3/
Currently there are limited programs like Freeze & Share which allow a woman to freeze their eggs at a heavy discount if they donate ~ half of the mature eggs retrieved. 2/

Egg freezing costs upwards of $15k.. an expensive insurance policy for women in 20s/early 30s . Would more women freeze their eggs at this age if the cost was brought close to $0?
